fields.headline: Treat of the week
fields.bodyText: White vanilla blancmange with whipped double cream gets spooned into crisp shortcrust pastry cases and swirled with crushed raspberries. For the pastry 125g unsalted butter 100g icing sugar 250g plain flour 2 egg yolks For the white custard 325g milk ½ vanilla pod 75g caster sugar 2 egg whites 3 tbsp plain flour 285ml double cream 200g frozen raspberries, thawed and crushed with 100g caster sugar Preheat the oven to 170C/325F/gas mark 3. Either rub the butter into the icing sugar and flour, or mix in a food processor until combined. Add the egg yolks and work to a dough. Press into a block, chill for one hour, then leave at room temperature to soften slightly. Roll thinly and line a muffin tray with circles of dough. Press a paper muffin case into each pocket, to keep the pastry upright. Bake for 20-25 minutes until dry and golden. Leave to cool in the tin, then remove the paper cases. For the custard, heat the milk with the vanilla. Meanwhile whisk the sugar, egg whites and flour until smooth, then slowly beat in the hot milk. Return to the pan and whisk until boiling. Remove from the heat, sieve, press baking parchment on the top to stop a skin forming and leave to cool. Whip the cream to soft peaks, fold through the custard and spoon into the cases. Blob teaspoons of crushed raspberries with a little juice over this and swirl to combine.
